accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions. A portion of the collection is unprocessed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Norfolk County (Va.) Records, 1740-1899 (bulk 1800-1899). Local government records collection, Chesapeake (City) Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of records from the circuit court of Chesapeake.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Norfolk County was created in 1691 when Lower Norfolk County was divided into Norfolk County and Princess Anne County. Norfolk County became extinct on 1 January 1963, when it was consolidated with the city of South Norfolk to form the city of Chesapeake. The county seat was Portsmouth.

scopecontent.p: Norfolk County (Va.) Records, 1740-1899 (bulk 1800-1899), consist predominantly of Judgments, Road and Bridge Records, and Land Records. Road and Bridge records include plats. The collection also includes Wills, Overseers of the Poor Records, Bonds, Commisions, and Oaths, School Records, Military and Pension Records, Organization Records, Tax and Fiscal Records, and Fiduciary Records.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Norfolk County Court Records are found at the Library of Virginia.
Additional Norfolk County Court Records can be found on microfilm at The Library of Virginia. See A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm
